sub_title: Content Marketer at The Linq Group. I tell stories. Sometimes I design things. üé® Mostly, I talk about creativity and marketing (and my own workplace insecurities üëÄ)
summary:
Hey, I‚Äôm Carmen üëãüèª I‚Äôm a content creator and storyteller. Here is my story üëá
 
As a kid, I loved leafing through my Dad‚Äôs outdoor sports catalogs. I was fascinated by how brands used storytelling through beautiful images and captivating copy. It felt more like reading a storybook that let my imagination run wild, rather than looking at ads. 

And, I thought;
Someday, I want to create something like this. Stories that inspire people. üåå 

Right after I graduated high school, I packed my bags and left my little hometown in Austria to move to the US for a year. ‚úàÔ∏è My fascination with storytelling never left me, so I packed my bags again to move straight to the Netherlands to pursue a Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Creative Business (class of ‚Äò22üéì)

Since then, I have:

üìö Started to dive deeper into my passion for psychology, strategy, and creative thinking - using my knowledge and skills to manage social media channels, create content strategies, and lead creative projects at different companies.

‚ú® Discovered my entrepreneurial spirit - worked on my start-up idea, pitched it to different audiences, and got a glimpse of the innovative, fast-paced start-up world (failed and learned a lot in the process).

ü§ì Started to embrace my curiosity - my yearly book count is starting to catch up with Bill Gates‚Äô, and now I occasionally geek out on Neuroscience and Greek Mythology. #nevernotlearning
